    "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/756703?"
  },
  "repo": {
    "id": 2180736,
    "name": "NuGet/NuGetGallery",
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery"
  },
  "payload": {
    "action": "created",
    "issue": {
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741",
      "repository_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery",
      "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741/labels{/name}",
      "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741/comments",
      "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741/events",
      "html_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741",
      "id": 219062091,
      "number": 3741,
      "title": "Fix for 2483 Author and description null checks & tests",
      "user": {
        "login": "robertmuehsig",
        "id": 756703,
        "avatar_url": "https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/756703?v=3",
        "gravatar_id": "",
        "url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/robertmuehsig",
        "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/followers",
        "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/following{/other_user}",
        "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/gists{/gist_id}",
        "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
        "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/subscriptions",
        "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/orgs",
        "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/repos",
        "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/events{/privacy}",
        "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/received_events",
        "type": "User",
        "site_admin": false
      },
      "labels": [
        {
          "id": 211942296,
          "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/labels/cla-already-signed",
          "name": "cla-already-signed",
          "color": "009800",
          "default": false
        }
      ],
      "state": "open",
      "locked": false,
      "assignee": null,
      "assignees": [],
      "milestone": null,
      "comments": 1,
      "created_at": "2017-04-03T21:07:20Z",
      "updated_at": "2017-04-04T19:59:24Z",
      "closed_at": null,
      "pull_request": {
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pulls/3741",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741",
        "diff_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741.diff",
        "patch_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741.patch"
      },
      "body": "Fix for #2483\r\n\r\nI enhanced the PackageValidation for the \"null-cases\" for the description and author element. The NuGet package author itself is never (or at least currently) null, but maybe filled with an empty element. \r\n\r\nNo <description> element set (or an empty description element will trigger the same behavior):\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631582/25803aee-18c1-11e7-9866-b0b50f09558f.png)\r\n\r\nNo <authors> or <owners> element set:\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631601/341a3500-18c1-11e7-9372-4c05a6e19518.png)\r\n\r\nWithout those checks some other processes might fail (e.g. the lucene job needs the description and might fail if it is null).\r\n\r\nCurrently you could upload something without the author tag, but when you try to update it you will get a validation error:\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631678/7f0c099e-18c1-11e7-893c-649b513d8f40.png)\r\n\r\nThis PR should fix the null handling and discard any uploads without a description or an empty author.\r\n\r\nIt seems that a empty <description></description> is also catched, because somewhere in the pipeline the description will be set to null instead of string.empty in this case, so even if you submit an empty description, the code will discard the upload."
    },
    "comment": {
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/comments/291614608",
      "html_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741#issuecomment-291614608",
      "issue_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741",
      "id": 291614608,
      "user": {
        "login": "robertmuehsig",
        "id": 756703,
        "avatar_url": "https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/756703?v=3",
        "gravatar_id": "",
        "url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/robertmuehsig",
        "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/followers",
        "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/following{/other_user}",
        "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/gists{/gist_id}",
        "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
        "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/subscriptions",
        "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/orgs",
        "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/repos",
        "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/events{/privacy}",
        "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/received_events",
        "type": "User",
        "site_admin": false
      },
      "created_at": "2017-04-04T19:59:24Z",
      "updated_at": "2017-04-04T19:59:24Z",
      "body": "I removed the author validation. So if you upload a package without any owner or author information it will pass, but if you ever try to update it via the UI the field is marked as \"required\"."

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "URLs contains baseurl + full url permalink " (#178) at jekyll/jekyll-seo-tag
Events.RelatedBody:
I discovered that the seo plugin produce wrong URLs and I'm not sure if I did something wrong from the configuration side.

Currently something like this is generated:

```
  <!-- Begin Jekyll SEO tag v2.1.0 -->
<title>Server Installation</title>
<meta property="og:title" content="Server Installation" />
<link rel="canonical" href="http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/" />
<meta property="og:url" content="http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/" />
<script type="application/ld+json">
{"@context": "http://schema.org",
"@type": "WebPage",
"headline": "Server Installation",
"url": "http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/"}</script>
<!-- End Jekyll SEO tag -->
```

As you can see the plugin will generates something like this: http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/

The configuration looks like this:

```
# This is the default format.
# For more see: http://jekyllrb.com/docs/permalinks/
permalink: /:categories/:title/

exclude: [".rvmrc", ".rbenv-version", "README.md", "Rakefile", "changelog.md", "LICENSE.txt", "_stage"]
highlighter: 'rouge' 

markdown: kramdown

kramdown:
  input: GFM
  syntax_highlighter: rouge
  
include: ['_pages']

baseurl: http://docs.oneoffixx.com
github_repo_url: https://github.com/OneOffixx/docs/

gems:
  - jekyll-sitemap
  - jekyll-seo-tag
```

And a typical page has this yaml:

```
---
layout: page
title: Übersicht
permalink: "concepts/de/overview/"
---
```

How do I get rid of the double URLs?

(notice that I disable the plugin on our site because of this issue) The site is hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/Sevitec/oneoffixx-docs)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "URLs contains baseurl + full url permalink " (#178) at jekyll/jekyll-seo-tag
Events.RelatedBody:
I discovered that the seo plugin produce wrong URLs and I'm not sure if I did something wrong from the configuration side.

Currently something like this is generated:

```
  <!-- Begin Jekyll SEO tag v2.1.0 -->
<title>Server Installation</title>
<meta property="og:title" content="Server Installation" />
<link rel="canonical" href="http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/" />
<meta property="og:url" content="http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/" />
<script type="application/ld+json">
{"@context": "http://schema.org",
"@type": "WebPage",
"headline": "Server Installation",
"url": "http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/install/de/server/"}</script>
<!-- End Jekyll SEO tag -->
```

As you can see the plugin will generates something like this: http://docs.oneoffixx.com/http://docs.oneoffixx.com/

The configuration looks like this:

```
# This is the default format.
# For more see: http://jekyllrb.com/docs/permalinks/
permalink: /:categories/:title/

exclude: [".rvmrc", ".rbenv-version", "README.md", "Rakefile", "changelog.md", "LICENSE.txt", "_stage"]
highlighter: 'rouge' 

markdown: kramdown

kramdown:
  input: GFM
  syntax_highlighter: rouge
  
include: ['_pages']

baseurl: http://docs.oneoffixx.com
github_repo_url: https://github.com/OneOffixx/docs/

gems:
  - jekyll-sitemap
  - jekyll-seo-tag
```

And a typical page has this yaml:

```
---
layout: page
title: Übersicht
permalink: "concepts/de/overview/"
---
```

How do I get rid of the double URLs?

(notice that I disable the plugin on our site because of this issue) The site is hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/Sevitec/oneoffixx-docs)

      "user": {

        "id": 756703,
        "avatar_url": "https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/756703?v=3",
        "gravatar_id": "",

        "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/received_events",
        "type": "User",
        "site_admin": false
      },
      "labels": [
        {
          "id": 211942296,
          "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/labels/cla-already-signed",
          "name": "cla-already-signed",
          "color": "009800",
          "default": false
        }
      ],
      "state": "open",
      "locked": false,
      "assignee": null,
      "assignees": [],
      "milestone": null,
      "comments": 0,
      "created_at": "2017-04-03T21:07:20Z",
      "updated_at": "2017-04-03T21:48:12Z",
      "closed_at": null,
      "pull_request": {
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pulls/3741",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741",
        "diff_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741.diff",
        "patch_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741.patch"
      },
      "body": "Fix for #2483\r\n\r\nI enhanced the PackageValidation for the \"null-cases\" for the description and author element. The NuGet package author itself is never (or at least currently) null, but maybe filled with an empty element. \r\n\r\nNo <description> element set (or an empty description element will trigger the same behavior):\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631582/25803aee-18c1-11e7-9866-b0b50f09558f.png)\r\n\r\nNo <authors> or <owners> element set:\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631601/341a3500-18c1-11e7-9372-4c05a6e19518.png)\r\n\r\nWithout those checks some other processes might fail (e.g. the lucene job needs the description and might fail if it is null).\r\n\r\nCurrently you could upload something without the author tag, but when you try to update it you will get a validation error:\r\n\r\n![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631678/7f0c099e-18c1-11e7-893c-649b513d8f40.png)\r\n\r\nThis PR should fix the null handling and discard any uploads without a description or an empty author.\r\n\r\nIt seems that a empty <description></description> is also catched, because somewhere in the pipeline the description will be set to null instead of string.empty in this case, so even if you submit an empty description, the code will discard the upload."
    },
    "comment": {
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/comments/291284166",
      "html_url": "https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/3741#issuecomment-291284166",
      "issue_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3741",
      "id": 291284166,
      "user": {
        "login": "robertmuehsig",
        "id": 756703,
        "avatar_url": "https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/756703?v=3",
        "gravatar_id": "",
        "url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/robertmuehsig",
        "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/followers",
        "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/following{/other_user}",
        "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/gists{/gist_id}",
        "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
        "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/subscriptions",
        "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/orgs",
        "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/repos",
        "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/events{/privacy}",
        "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/robertmuehsig/received_events",
        "type": "User",
        "site_admin": false
      },
      "created_at": "2017-04-03T21:48:12Z",
      "updated_at": "2017-04-03T21:48:12Z",
      "body": "Regarding empty authors: Uploading without authors is ok, but changing the package via the edit form would still require a author? Or is this field no longer required?"
    }
  },
  "public": true,
  "created_at": "2017-04-03T21:48:12Z",
  "org": {

    "gravatar_id": "",
    "url": "https://api.github.com/orgs/NuGet",
    "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/968310?"
  }
}

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix for 2483 Author and description null checks & tests" (#3741) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fix for #2483

I enhanced the PackageValidation for the "null-cases" for the description and author element. The NuGet package author itself is never (or at least currently) null, but maybe filled with an empty element. 

No <description> element set:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631582/25803aee-18c1-11e7-9866-b0b50f09558f.png)

No <authors> or <owners> element set:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631601/341a3500-18c1-11e7-9372-4c05a6e19518.png)

Without those checks some other processes might fail (e.g. the lucene job needs the description and might fail if it is null).

Currently you could upload something without the author tag, but when you try to update it you will get a validation error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756703/24631678/7f0c099e-18c1-11e7-893c-649b513d8f40.png)

This PR should fix the null handling and discard any uploads without a description or an empty author.

It seems that a empty <description></description> is also catched, because somewhere in the pipeline the description will be set to null instead of string.empty in this case, so even if you submit an empty description, the code will discard the upload.
